#Text=French parliament approves bill on Armenian Genocide denial
#Text=Thursday , October 12 , 2006
#Text=Today , the French National Assembly passed a bill that would penalise what the bill calls negationism of the Armenian Genocide .

#Text=The French government however opposes the bill ; Catherine Colonna , Minister charged with European Affairs , reacted that " It 's the task , first and foremost , of historians and not of lawmakers to clarify history . "
#Text=The label " genocide " is disputed by the Turkish government , who has called the vote a " serious blow " to diplomatic relations .

column1: #Text=Turkey has been known to prosecute Turkish intellectuals who discuss the Armenian genocide , including recent Nobel Prize winner Orhan Pamuk .
#Text=Under the Turkish Penal Code , " prosecution for anti-national plots " faces those who call " for the recognition of the Armenian genocide " .

column1: #Text=Turkey 's Prime Minister Erdoğan had warned France to look into its own colonial past in Africa instead of demanding Turkish recognition of the events .
#Text=Ali Babacan , the Turkish Minister of Economy , in Brussels for talks on Turkey 's E.U. -membership , said he could not exclude that people would start boycotting French products in Turkey .

#Text=In a recent visit to Armenia , the French President Jacques Chirac launched the idea that recognition as a " genocide " would be necessary for Turkey to enter the E.U. , causing the media to label it as the " Chirac criterion " .

column1: #Text=The European Commission , which has confirmed that such a criterion would not be instituted , deplored the initiative of the French parliament , because it could damage contacts with the European Union .
#Text=Most historians view the events comprising the Armenian genocide as a state-sponsored plan of mass extermination .

#Text=Their reasons include various eye witness reports , Turkey 's recruitment of violent criminals to posts within the " Special Organization " , and the sheer number of dead , estimates of which remain as high as 1.5 million .

column1: #Text=Some politically influential countries like the U.S. , Canada , and France have driven efforts to interpret these events as an attempt to eradicate an ethnic group .
#Text=The Turkish government , as well as a few historians , estimate the number of casualties much lower , and attribute them to inter-ethnic strife , disease and famine during World War I .
#Text=Armenia has congratulated France over its " natural response " to an " aggressive " policy of " denial " by the Turkish government .

column1: #Text=Armenians often argue that Turkey 's recognition will help prevent similar events in the future .
#Text=These assertions include claims that Scheubner-Richter 's observations of the Armenian genocide had a formative influence upon Hitler 's plans for the Jews .
#Text=The French bill provides for a 1-year prison sentence and a € 45,000 fine , the same as for Holocaust denial .

#Text=It must still be approved by the Senate and the President , and due to the parliamentary calendar , news sources think it is unlikely that it will be discussed before the end of the legislation period in February 2007 .
